page.title: 15Farming
page.content: The average size farm in this area is about 250 acres.Hill-farming is the best description,concentrating on the rearing of sheep and cattle for the fatstock market.In the recent past,the farmers in the area have relied heavily on E.E.C. subsidies which have helped to maintain a way of life traditional to Radnor. Apart from the farmhouse,there would normally be a hay barn,sillage pit, outbuildings for machinery,cattle and lambing sheds and a sheep dip.On most farms a hay crop would be grown and perhaps oats and barley for sillaging.Straw would be bought in. Since the war,increasing mechanisation has meant fewer workers on the land so that it is now possible for two men to look after a farm of this size with relative ease except during haymaking.
